summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackMelt away makeup while leaving skin feeling nourished with Neutrogena Makeup Remover Melting Balm. Formulated with vitamin E, the nourishing balm transforms to a luxurious oil to effortlessly melt off makeup.
details: DetailsBenefitsTravel-friendly Neutrogena Makeup Remover Melting Balm to OilPowerful makeup remover transforms from a balm to an oil to remove makeup and help nourish skinNourishing balm to oil effortlessly melts away makeupPowerful yet gentle formula removes even the most stubborn eye, face, and lip makeupGentle, nourishing balm removes makeup without leaving skin feeling strippedMelting oil balm from a dermatologist-recommended skincare brandTravel-friendly packaging makes it easy to toss makeup remover in a purse or bag for on-the-go useKey IngredientsVitamin E leaves skin feeling nourished, smooth, and conditionedItem 2582619How To UseProtect from Excessive Heat (40째C/104째F).IngredientsIsopropyl Palmitate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Paraffin, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Heptyl Undecylenate, Sorbeth-30 Tetraoleate, Neopentyl Glycol Diheptanoate, PEG-7 Glyceryl Cocoate, Isododecane, Microcrystalline Wax, Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax, Camellia Oleifera Seed Oil, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Bran Oil, Tocopherol, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil.

reviews.headline: My favorite makeup remover
reviews.comments: I use this mainly to remove my eye makeup, love that it's creamy not oily. No tug so it's gentle to the eye area.

reviews.headline: It works but you can get cheaper
reviews.comments: It works but you can get a cheaper makeup remover that does the same thing.

reviews.headline: Does Not Work
reviews.comments:
I love Neutrogena and since high school have used a lot of their products but this does not "melt away" my makeup at all. And I dont use waterproof makeup. 
I'm glad this was given to me as a gift to try and did not spend my own money on it.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product over again and again
reviews.comments: It help remove any make-ups left on your face and feel good.  I highly recommend this product.

reviews.headline: buy another balm or stick to Neutrogena wipes
reviews.comments: I wear a full face of makeup and do not wear waterproof eye makeup. This wasn't the best remover balm I've tried. I definitely needed to still double cleanse and sometimes use another remover to get the makeup from my under eyes.

reviews.headline: Good for Oil Pulling
reviews.comments: This is the only melting balm I've ever tried and I love it. I use this at night before bed WITHOUT water before applying. I apply it with my hand and rub it in for a few minutes to remove sunscreen/ makeup and oil pull. It's so satisfying feeling the little grains of gunk coming out of my pores. I then rinse it all off with water and double cleanse with a foaming cleanser. It also helps my acne and doesn't break me out more.

reviews.headline: weird film
reviews.comments: it does work fine, not amazingly well, but the deal breaker for me is that it leaves a greasy film. that is a no go for me.

reviews.headline: no scoop
reviews.comments: I would rate this 5 stars if a scoop came with it

reviews.headline: Best around
reviews.comments:
This is my 40 years in the beauty industry and this works the best. There are steps to  makeup removal.
Use Cleasing balm, remove with large cotton pad, then use my eye makeup remover with small cotton pad, then I rinse. I cleanse my face with a cleanser, then my nighttime skincare route. I'm 61 but look 20 years younger. It takes time taking care of you skin.

reviews.headline: Good product
reviews.comments: Was in the market for a melting balm. I really like this. It doesn't leave your face feeling dry at all. Recommend

reviews.headline: Fine
reviews.comments: This is my first experience with a cleansing balm.  This worked well at removing my tinted sunscreen.  I still had to work at removing my waterproof mascara.  Also, this balm definitely requires a second cleanse as I could not remove it with warm water alone.  It works ok for the price but I will try something else next time.

reviews.headline: Great drugstore cleansing balm
reviews.comments: My skin was flaky-I think because my spf wasn't being removed well. This fixed the problem. It's very gentle and fragrance free and rinses clean. Great stuff.

reviews.headline: toxic to humans and nature
reviews.comments: Not healthiest ingredients, potential carcinogen and toxic to liver can cause inflammation and ingestion. not even good for nature

reviews.headline: its ok
reviews.comments: the only good thing about this is if you need something to remove your make up that is cheap. but I leaves so much oil on your face that make you feel gross. it doesn't really remove water proof make up

reviews.headline: My Go-to
reviews.comments: I've been using it for a couple of years now. It's always going to be my go-to. Takes off the toughest mascara which is the biggest plus for me.

reviews.headline: It's just ok
reviews.comments: It may be just OK for removing make up but it's a tad oily/greasy for me. It definitely is not good for  removing mascara unless you want to tug at your eyes and make more wrinkles and lines. I would not recommend this. It does not work as was advertised. I had high hopes and expectations for this, and definitely did not live up to its hype.

reviews.headline: Breaks me out
reviews.comments: This balm works great but causes me cystic acne.  It looks like I might be the only one though!

reviews.headline: Best for the price
reviews.comments:
I am very confused by the reviews - i love double cleansing and love makeup remover balms and tried almost all of them under the 20$ and this is the best in this price range! It glides smoothly and removes everything so nicely, well except eye makeup- i always use an eye makeup remover for the eyes so i havent tried this on my eyes. 
Highly recommend!

reviews.headline: Doesn't work!
reviews.comments:
Do not waste your money. I am obsessed with cleansing balms and have tried several brands.

This product, however, is absolute trash.
It did NOT remove my makeup as well as every other cleansing balm i have tried. I had to go back and use a different cleanser to finish removing my makeup (which always came off completely and cleanly without a second wash with every other one i have tried). 
Whats the point of buying something that doesnt do what it says it is supposed to do? Whats the point if i have to go back in with a different product to get what THIS one left behind? 
Also, it does not hydrate at all like other cleansing balms do. 
Complete waste of money. I threw mine in the trash.

reviews.headline: I did not like the product
reviews.comments: It did not take my eye makeup off after rubbing it on my eyelashes several minutes. I had to use something else to get the mascara completely off. I would not recommend this product!

faceoff_positive.comments: I saw a makeup remover balm on a YouTube short, and I wanted to give it a try! I saw this Neutrogena one and I was so impressed! I wear black eyeliner and mascara every single day, and when I have special occasions or something to go to, I have pretty heavy eye makeup on. This will turn into an oil in literally 2 seconds when you rub it and it does just what it says, melts off your makeup! It helps because you don't have any harsh rubbing that will damage your delicate eye skin. After I use this, I just take my makeup remover cloth and wipe it away! Tada! You're done! Then I just cleanse as normal! If you've been wanting to try a remover balm, this is a good one to start with for the price!
faceoff_positive.headline: Melts off makeup!

faceoff_negative.comments: Absolutely horrific. Was using this as the first step in my double cleanse, and it DID work well. I typically have flawless skin, maybe a hormonal zit occasionally. My face is now covered in painful cystic acne and closed comedones. At first I attributed it to trying out some different mental health meds, but then realized this was the culprit. Too bad I was 3/4 through with it and way too far into wrecking my face. It's full of lots of pore clogging ingredients, including coconut oil. I should've been more careful and looked at the ingredients first, but I usually feel pretty good about Neutrogena products. My face is completely destroyed and I'm so mortified. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
faceoff_negative.headline: Destroyed my skin. Beware!
